text: Yaakov Agmon () (24 June 1929 - 16 December 2020) was an Israeli theater producer, manager, and director. He was born in Tel Aviv. He was director of United Jewish Appeal and also as a columnist and the secretary of the Rimon weekly publication. In 1978, he founded Beit Lessin Theater.Linda Ben-Zvi. Theater in Israel. University of Michigan Press, 1996. . pg.22. See Theater in Israel on Google Books In 1995, Agmon was appointed general and artistic director of the Habima Theatre. In 2010, Agmon was appointed general manager of the Arabic-Hebrew theater of Jaffa. Agmon died on 16 December 2020 at a hospital in Ramat Gan from COVID-19 at the age of 91.Renowned director Yaakov Agmon dies at 91 ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Columnists Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Israel Category:Israeli journalists Category:Israeli businesspeople Category:People from Tel Aviv Category:Theatre directors Category:Theatre producers
